solution:
De $\sqrt{3} \cos \theta - \sin \theta = \frac{1}{3},$ 
\[\sin \theta = \sqrt{3} \cos \theta - \frac{1}{3}.\]
Substituindo em $\sin^2 \theta + \cos^2 \theta = 1,$ obtemos 
\[3 \cos^2 \theta - \frac{2 \sqrt{3}}{3} \cos \theta + \frac{1}{9} + \cos^2 \theta = 1.\]
Isso simplifica para $18 \cos^2 \theta - 3 \sqrt{3} \cos \theta - 4 = 0.$ 
Pela fórmula quadrática, 
\[\cos \theta = \frac{\sqrt{3} \pm \sqrt{35}}{12}.\]
Como $0 < \theta < \frac{\pi}{2},$ $\cos \theta$ é positiva, então $\cos \theta = \frac{\sqrt{3} + \sqrt{35}}{12}.$

Portanto,
\begin{align*}
\sqrt{3} \sin \theta + \cos \theta &= \sqrt{3} \left( \sqrt{3} \cos \theta - \frac{1}{3} \right) + \cos \theta \\
&= 3 \cos \theta - \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3} + \cos \theta \\
&= 4 \cos \theta - \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3} \\
&= \frac{\sqrt{3} + \sqrt{35}}{3} - \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3} \\
&= \boxed{\frac{\sqrt{35}}{3}}.
\end{align*}
